00032 unsigned int JMA_CType_EUCJP::getByteCount(const char* p) const
00033 {
00034         assert(p);
00035         const unsigned char* uc = (const unsigned char*)p;
00036 
00037         if(uc[0] == 0)
00038                 return 0;
00039 
00040         if(uc[0] < 0x80)
00041                 return 1; // encoding in ASCII
00042 
00043         assert(uc[1] && uc[1] >= 0x80);
00044         return 2; // encoding in EUC-JP
00045 }
00046 
00047 bool JMA_CType_EUCJP::isSpace(const char* p) const
00048 {
00049     assert(p);
00050 
00051     const unsigned char* uc = (const unsigned char*)p;
00052 
00053     if(uc[0] < 0x80)
00054         return isspace(uc[0]); // check by std library
00055 
00056     //full-width space in EUC-JP
00057     if(uc[0] == 0xa1 && uc[1] == 0xa1)
00058         return true;
00059 
00060     return false;
00061 }
00062 
00063 string JMA_CType_EUCJP::replaceSpaces(const char* str, char replacement)
00064 {
00065         unsigned char replace = (unsigned char)replacement;
00066         const unsigned char* uc = (const unsigned char*)str;
00067         string ret(str);
00068         unsigned char* c2 = (unsigned char*)ret.data();
00069 
00070     const unsigned int length = ret.size();
00071     for(unsigned int i=0; i<length;)
00072         {
00073                 if(uc[i] < 0x80)
00074                 {
00075                         if(isspace(uc[i]))
00076                                 c2[i] = replace;
00077             ++i;
00078                 }
00079                 else
00080                 {
00081                         //full-width space in EUC-JP
00082                         if(uc[i] == 0xa1 && uc[i+1] == 0xa1)
00083                         {
00084                                 c2[i] = c2[i+1] = replace;
00085                         }
00086                         i += 2;
00087                 }
00088         }
00089 
00090         return ret;
00091 }
